page.title: 12Quarnford Village Fete
page.content: On Saturday, 8th of June at Flash Village Hall there were two queens. First came the retiring queen. The school childen played on the recorders and the attendants followed. Second was Tracey who was the new queen. Stephen carried the tiara and Andrew carried the trumpet. The queen wore a white dress. Mr Rodgers opened the fete. The school children sang two songs. They were "Grandfather" and "Super califragllitic expialigotious". The queen and her attendants and page boys had tea. They went to the Travellers Rest and back. Flash school children had some games. They were roll 2p, treasure map, hoopla, manic miner, flick a ball, and lucky ball. There was atombola too. The attendants were Judith and Elinor Crockford. They had white dresses with blue flowers on.
